message.content:
Below is a step‐by‐step analysis and build‐sequence for **both** of the structures shown in the main image, using only the blocks (in the orientations) given in the dictionary image.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1)  ANALYSIS OF THE MAIN (TARGET) IMAGE
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
■  There are **two separate structures**:

A)  LEFT “HOUSE” (5 total blocks; 3 layers):
   • Layer 1 (bottom):  One red arch block.  
       – Arch opening faces front.  
   • Layer 2 (middle): Two cubes side by side (green on one side, blue on the other).  
   • Layer 3 (top/roof): Two orange triangular wedges forming a pitched roof (sloping left ↔ right).

B)  RIGHT “TOWER” (9 total blocks; 4 layers):
   • Layer 1 (bottom): Three red arch blocks, all with the arch opening facing front.  
   • Layer 2: One long yellow rectangular block bridging across the left and right arches.  
   • Layer 3: Two green cubes (side by side) atop the yellow block, plus a tall, red arch piece over the center gap.  
   • Layer 4 (roof): Two orange triangular wedges forming the pitched roof (sloping left ↔ right).

■  In total, **14 blocks** are used between the two structures.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
2)  REQUIRED BLOCK INDICES (FROM THE DICTIONARY)
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Below is the exact choice of blocks (no rotations other than what is shown in the dictionary).  
Remember, the same index can be reused multiple times.

●  Left “House” (5 blocks)
   1)  #2  (red arch)  
   2)  #7  (green cube)  
   3)  #6  (blue cube)  
   4)  #13 (orange triangular wedge)  
   5)  #16 (orange triangular wedge)  

●  Right “Tower” (9 blocks)
   1)  #2  (red arch) – used three times for the base  
   2)  #8  (long yellow rectangular block)  
   3)  #7  (green cube) – used twice  
   4)  #5  (tall red arch block)  
   5)  #13 (orange wedge)  
   6)  #16 (orange wedge)

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
3)  STEP‐BY‐STEP ASSEMBLY INSTRUCTIONS
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Below is one convenient order (you can of course build the left house first or interleave the steps differently):

{
  Step1:  Move block with index 2   (place the single arch for the left “house”)
  Step2:  Move block with index 7   (green cube on top of that arch)
  Step3:  Move block with index 6   (blue cube beside the green cube)
  Step4:  Move block with index 13  (left roof wedge on top)
  Step5:  Move block with index 16  (right roof wedge on top)

  Step6:  Move block with index 2   (1st arch at bottom of right “tower”)
  Step7:  Move block with index 2   (2nd arch at bottom of right “tower”)
  Step8:  Move block with index 2   (3rd arch at bottom of right “tower”)

  Step9:  Move block with index 8   (long yellow block across top of those arches)

  Step10: Move block with index 7   (first green cube on top of the yellow block)
  Step11: Move block with index 7   (second green cube alongside the first)

  Step12: Move block with index 5   (tall red arch spanning above the two green cubes)

  Step13: Move block with index 13  (left wedge of the tower roof)
  Step14: Move block with index 16  (right wedge of the tower roof)
}

That completes the two structures exactly as shown in the target image.
